Description: Official country name as reported by the WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme (JMP)
Three-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code, used for standardized country identification
Calendar year of the estimate
Total population of the country in the given year (in thousands)
Population residence type
Short code identifying the drinking water service level indicator
Descriptive name of the drinking water service level
Percentage of the population (by country, year, and residence type) with access to the specified drinking water service level
Abbreviated World Bank income classification
World Bank income group classification
SDG regional grouping used by the United Nations
Description
At least basic drinking water services (improved source within a 30-minute round trip)
Limited drinking water services (improved source requiring more than 30 minutes round trip)
Unimproved drinking water sources
Surface water use (e.g., rivers, lakes, ponds)
Safely managed drinking water services (basic service plus accessibility, availability, and quality criteria)
Drinking water accessible on premises
Drinking water available when needed
Drinking water free from contamination
